name: src/account.js
Account
description: An account key pair (public and secret keys).

name: constructor
description:
Create a new Account object

If the secretKey parameter is not provided a new key pair is randomly
created for the account

params.name: secretKey
params.description: Secret key for the account

name: publicKey
description: The public key for this account

name: secretKey
description: The **unencrypted** secret key for this account

name: src/budget-program.js
SignatureCondition
description:
Represents a condition that is met by executing a `applySignature()`
transaction

properties.name: type
properties.description: Must equal the string 'timestamp'

properties.name: from
properties.description: Public key from which `applySignature()` will be accepted from

name: TimestampCondition
description:
Represents a condition that is met by executing a `applyTimestamp()`
transaction

properties.name: type
properties.description: Must equal the string 'timestamp'

properties.name: from
properties.description: Public key from which `applyTimestamp()` will be accepted from

properties.name: when
properties.description: The timestamp that was observed

name: Payment
description: Represents a payment to a given public key

properties.name: amount
properties.description: Number of lamports

properties.name: to
properties.description: Public key of the recipient

name: BudgetCondition
description: A condition that can unlock a payment

name: BudgetProgram
description: Factory class for transactions to interact with the Budget program

name: programId
description: Public key that identifies the Budget program

name: space
description: The amount of space this program requires

name: timestampCondition
description: Creates a timestamp condition

name: signatureCondition
description: Creates a signature condition

name: pay
description: Generates a transaction that transfers lamports once any of the conditions are met

name: payOnBoth
description: Generates a transaction that transfers lamports once both conditions are met

name: applyTimestamp
description:
Generates a transaction that applies a timestamp, which could enable a
pending payment to proceed.

name: applySignature
description:
Generates a transaction that applies a signature, which could enable a
pending payment to proceed.

name: src/connection.js
ContactInfo
description: Information describing a cluster node

properties.name: pubkey
properties.description: Identity public key of the node

properties.name: gossip
properties.description: Gossip network address for the node

properties.name: tpu
properties.description: TPU network address for the node (null if not available)

properties.name: rpc
properties.description: JSON RPC network address for the node (null if not available)

name: VoteAccountInfo
description: Information describing a vote account

properties.name: votePubkey
properties.description: Public key of the vote account

properties.name: nodePubkey
properties.description: Identity public key of the node voting with this account

properties.name: stake
properties.description: The stake, in lamports, delegated to this vote account

properties.name: commission
properties.description: A 32-bit integer used as a fraction (commission/0xFFFFFFFF) for rewards payout

name: SignatureSuccess

name: TransactionError

name: Connection
description: A connection to a fullnode JSON RPC endpoint

name: constructor
description: Establish a JSON RPC connection

params.name: endpoint
params.description: URL to the fullnode JSON RPC endpoint

name: getBalance
description: Fetch the balance for the specified public key

name: getAccountInfo
description: Fetch all the account info for the specified public key

name: confirmTransaction
description: Confirm the transaction identified by the specified signature

name: getClusterNodes
description: Return the list of nodes that are currently participating in the cluster

name: getEpochVoteAccounts
description: Return the list of nodes that are currently participating in the cluster

name: getSlotLeader
description: Fetch the current slot leader of the cluster

name: getSignatureStatus
description: Fetch the current transaction count of the cluster

name: getTransactionCount
description: Fetch the current transaction count of the cluster

name: getRecentBlockhash
description: Fetch a recent blockhash from the cluster

name: requestAirdrop
description: Request an allocation of lamports to the specified account

name: sendTransaction
description: Sign and send a transaction

name: sendRawTransaction
description:
Send a transaction that has already been signed and serialized into the
wire format

name: onAccountChange
description: Register a callback to be invoked whenever the specified account changes

params.name: publicKey
params.description: Public key of the account to monitor

params.name: callback
params.description: Function to invoke whenever the account is changed

name: removeAccountChangeListener
description: Deregister an account notification callback

params.name: id
params.description: subscription id to deregister

name: onProgramAccountChange
description:
Register a callback to be invoked whenever accounts owned by the
specified program change

params.name: programId
params.description: Public key of the program to monitor

params.name: callback
params.description: Function to invoke whenever the account is changed

name: removeProgramAccountChangeListener
description: Deregister an account notification callback

params.name: id
params.description: subscription id to deregister

params.description:
If not null, create a delegate account that when authorized

return.description: Public key of the new empty token account

name: src/transaction.js
PACKET_DATA_SIZE
description:
Maximum over-the-wire size of a Transaction

1280 is IPv6 minimum MTU
40 bytes is the size of the IPv6 header
8 bytes is the size of the fragment header

name: TransactionInstructionCtorFields
description: List of TransactionInstruction object fields that may be initialized at construction

name: TransactionInstruction
description: Transaction Instruction class

name: keys
description:
Public keys to include in this transaction
Boolean represents whether this pubkey needs to sign the transaction

name: programId
description: Program Id to execute

name: data
description: Program input

name: TransactionCtorFields
description: List of Transaction object fields that may be initialized at construction

properties.name: (?recentBlockhash}
properties.description: A recent block hash

properties.name: (?signatures}
properties.description: One or more signatures

name: Transaction
description: Transaction class

name: signatures
description:
Signatures for the transaction.  Typically created by invoking the
`sign()` method

name: signature
description: The first (payer) Transaction signature

name: instructions
description: The instructions to atomically execute

name: recentBlockhash
description: A recent transaction id.  Must be populated by the caller

name: constructor
description: Construct an empty Transaction

name: add
description: Add one or more instructions to this Transaction

name: sign
description:
Sign the Transaction with the specified accounts.  Multiple signatures may
be applied to a Transaction. The first signature is considered "primary"
and is used when testing for Transaction confirmation.

Transaction fields should not be modified after the first call to `sign`,
as doing so may invalidate the signature and cause the Transaction to be
rejected.

The Transaction must be assigned a valid `recentBlockhash` before invoking this method

name: signPartial
description:
Partially sign a Transaction with the specified accounts.  The `Account`
inputs will be used to sign the Transaction immediately, while any
`PublicKey` inputs will be referenced in the signed Transaction but need to
be filled in later by calling `addSigner()` with the matching `Account`.

All the caveats from the `sign` method apply to `signPartial`

name: addSigner
description:
Fill in a signature for a partially signed Transaction.  The `signer` must
be the corresponding `Account` for a `PublicKey` that was previously provided to
`signPartial`

name: serialize
description:
Serialize the Transaction in the wire format.

The Transaction must have a valid `signature` before invoking this method

name: keys
description: Deprecated method

name: programId
description: Deprecated method

name: data
description: Deprecated method

name: from
description: Parse a wire transaction into a Transaction object.

sendAndConfirmRawTransaction
description: Sign, send and confirm a raw transaction

sendAndConfirmTransaction
description: Sign, send and confirm a transaction

channel

content:
[![Build status][travis-image]][travis-url] [![codecov][codecov-image]][codecov-url] [![esdoc][esdoc-image]][esdoc-url]
[![npm][npm-image]][npm-url] [![npm-downloads][npm-downloads-image]][npm-url] [![david][david-deps-image]][david-deps-url] [![david][david-dev-deps-image]][david-dev-deps-url]
[![semantic-release][semantic-release-image]][semantic-release-url] [![code-style-prettier][code-style-prettier-image]][code-style-prettier-url] [travis-image]: https://api.travis-ci.org/solana-labs/solana-web3.js.svg?branch=master [travis-url]: https://travis-ci.org/solana-labs/solana-web3.js [codecov-image]: https://codecov.io/gh/solana-labs/solana-web3.js/branch/master/graph/badge.svg [codecov-url]: https://codecov.io/gh/solana-labs/solana-web3.js [esdoc-image]: https://solana-labs.github.io/solana-web3.js/badge.svg [npm-image]: https://img.shields.io/npm/v/@solana/web3.js.svg?style=flat [npm-downloads-image]: https://img.shields.io/npm/dm/@solana/web3.js.svg?style=flat [esdoc-url]: https://solana-labs.github.io/solana-web3.js/ [npm-url]: https://www.npmjs.com/package/@solana/web3.js [david-deps-image]: https://david-dm.org/solana-labs/solana-web3.js.svg [david-deps-url]: https://david-dm.org/solana-labs/solana-web3.js [david-dev-deps-image]: https://david-dm.org/solana-labs/solana-web3.js/dev-status.svg [david-dev-deps-url]: https://david-dm.org/solana-labs/solana-web3.js?type=dev [semantic-release-image]: https://img.shields.io/badge/%20%20%F0%9F%93%A6%F0%9F%9A%80-semantic--release-e10079.svg [semantic-release-url]: https://github.com/semantic-release/semantic-release [code-style-prettier-image]: https://img.shields.io/badge/code_style-prettier-ff69b4.svg?style=flat-square [code-style-prettier-url]: https://github.com/prettier/prettier # Solana JavaScript API This is the Solana Javascript API built on the Solana [JSON RPC API](https://solana-labs.github.io/solana/jsonrpc-api.html) [Latest API Documentation](https://solana-labs.github.io/solana-web3.js/) ## Installation ### Yarn ``` $ yarn add @solana/web3.js ``` ### npm ``` $ npm install --save @solana/web3.js ``` ### Browser bundle ```html ``` ### BPF program development clang-7.0 must be installed to build BPF programs, such as `examples/bpf-c-noop/`. See `bpf-sdk/README.md` for installation details. Rust must be installed to build Rust BPF programs, see: https://www.rust-lang.org/install.html such as `examples/bpf-rust-noop/`. See https://www.rust-lang.org/install.html for installation details. ## Usage ### Javascript ```js const solanaWeb3 = require('@solana/web3.js'); console.log(solanaWeb3); ``` ### ES6 ```js import solanaWeb3 from '@solana/web3.js'; console.log(solanaWeb3); ``` ### Browser bundle ```js // `solanaWeb3` is provided in the global namespace by the `solanaWeb3.min.js` script bundle. console.log(solanaWeb3); ``` ## Local Network The `solana-localnet` program is provided to easily start a test Solana cluster locally on your machine. Docker must be installed. The JSON RPC endpoint of the local cluster is `http://localhost:8899`. To start, first fetch the latest Docker image by running: ```bash $ npx solana-localnet update ``` Then run the following command to start the cluster ```bash $ npx solana-localnet up ``` While the cluster is running logs are available with: ```bash $ npx solana-localnet logs -f ``` Stop the cluster with: ```bash $ npx solana-localnet down ``` ## Flow A [Flow library definition](https://flow.org/en/docs/libdefs/) is provided at [module.flow.js](https://github.com/solana-labs/solana-web3.js/tree/master/module.flow.js). Add the following line under the [libs] section of your project's .flowconfig to activate it: ```ini [libs] node_modules/@solana/web3.js/module.flow.js ``` ## Examples See the [examples/](https://github.com/solana-labs/solana-web3.js/tree/master/examples) directory for small snippets. Standalone examples: * Web wallet: https://github.com/solana-labs/example-webwallet * Tic-tac-toe: https://github.com/solana-labs/example-tictactoe ## Releases Releases are available on [Github](https://github.com/solana-labs/solana-web3.js/releases) and [npmjs.com](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@solana/web3.js) Each Github release features a tarball containing API documentation and a minified version of the module suitable for direct use in a browser environment (<script> tag)
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@solana/web3.js",
  "version": "0.0.0-development",
  "description": "Solana Javascript API",
  "keywords": [
    "api",
    "blockchain"
  ],
  "license": "MIT",
  "author": "Solana Maintainers <maintainers@solana.com>",
  "homepage": "https://solana.com/",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/solana-labs/solana-web3.js.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "http://github.com/solana-labs/solana-web3.js.git/issues"
  },
  "publishConfig": {
    "access": "public"
  },
  "main": "lib/index.cjs.js",
  "module": "lib/index.esm.js",
  "bin": {
    "solana-bpf-sdk-install": "bin/bpf-sdk-install.sh",
    "solana-localnet": "bin/localnet.sh"
  },
  "testnetDefaultChannel": "edge",
  "files": [
    "/bin",
    "/doc",
    "/examples",
    "/bpf-sdk",
    "/lib",
    "/module.flow.js",
    "/src"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "bpf-sdk:install": "bin/bpf-sdk-install.sh",
    "bpf-sdk:remove-symlinks": "find bpf-sdk -type l -print -exec cp {} {}.tmp \\; -exec mv {}.tmp {} \\;",
    "build": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production rollup -c",
    "clean": "rimraf ./coverage ./lib",
    "codecov": "set -ex; npm run test:cover; cat ./coverage/lcov.info | codecov",
    "dev": "cross-env NODE_ENV=development rollup -c",
    "doc": "set -ex; esdoc; node -p '\"\\nDocumentation coverage: \" + require(\"./doc/coverage.json\").coverage'",
    "doc:watch": "watch 'npm run doc' . --wait=1 --ignoreDirectoryPattern=/doc/",
    "examples": "set -ex; for example in examples/*.js; do node $example; done",
    "flow": "set -ex; flow stop; flow-typed install jest@24; flow",
    "flow:stop": "flow stop",
    "flow:watch": "flow stop; watch 'flow' . --wait=1 --ignoreDirectoryPattern=/doc/",
    "lint": "set -ex; npm run pretty; eslint .",
    "lint:fix": "npm run lint -- --fix",
    "lint:watch": "watch 'npm run lint:fix' . --wait=1 --ignoreDirectoryPattern=/doc/",
    "localnet:down": "bin/localnet.sh down",
    "localnet:logs": "bin/localnet.sh logs -f",
    "localnet:up": "bin/localnet.sh up $npm_package_testnetDefaultChannel",
    "localnet:update": "bin/localnet.sh update $npm_package_testnetDefaultChannel",
    "ok": "run-s --serial lint flow test doc",
    "prepare": "run-s clean bpf-sdk:install bpf-sdk:remove-symlinks build",
    "pretty": "prettier --write '{,{examples,src,test}/**/}*.js'",
    "re": "semantic-release --repository-url git@github.com:solana-labs/solana-web3.js.git",
    "test": "cross-env NODE_ENV=test jest --useStderr",
    "test:cover": "cross-env NODE_ENV=test jest --coverage --useStderr",
    "test:live": "cross-env NODE_ENV=test TEST_LIVE=1 jest --useStderr",
    "test:watch": "cross-env NODE_ENV=test jest --watch --useStderr"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/runtime": "^7.3.1",
    "bn.js": "^4.11.8",
    "bs58": "^4.0.1",
    "buffer-layout": "^1.2.0",
    "esdoc-inject-style-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "jayson": "^3.0.1",
    "mz": "^2.7.0",
    "node-fetch": "^2.2.0",
    "npm-run-all": "^4.1.5",
    "rpc-websockets": "^4.3.3",
    "superstruct": "^0.6.0",
    "tweetnacl": "^1.0.0",
    "ws": "^7.0.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.3.3",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties": "^7.3.3",
    "@babel/plugin-proposal-function-bind": "^7.2.0",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "^7.2.0",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.3.1",
    "@babel/preset-flow": "^7.0.0",
    "acorn": "^6.1.1",
    "babel-eslint": "10.0.2",
    "babel-plugin-module-resolver": "3.2.0",
    "codecov": "^3.0.4",
    "cross-env": "5.2.0",
    "elfy": "^0.1.0",
    "enzyme": "3.10.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-flow-type-plugin": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-importpath-plugin": "^1.0.2",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "5.16.0",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "^5.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "2.17.3",
    "eslint-plugin-jest": "22.7.1",
    "eslint-plugin-prettier": "^3.0.0",
    "flow-bin": "0.101.1",
    "flow-typed": "2.5.2",
    "fs-file-tree": "1.0.7",
    "jest": "24.8.0",
    "marked": "^0.6.0",
    "prettier": "^1.14.3",
    "rimraf": "2.6.3",
    "rollup": "1.15.2",
    "rollup-plugin-babel": "^4.3.2",
    "rollup-plugin-commonjs": "^10.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-json": "^4.0.0",
    "rollup-plugin-node-builtins": "^2.1.2",
    "rollup-plugin-node-globals": "^1.2.1",
    "rollup-plugin-node-resolve": "5.0.4",
    "rollup-plugin-replace": "2.2.0",
    "rollup-plugin-terser": "^5.0.0",
    "semantic-release": "^15.9.16",
